Text.Language: The prophecies of the First Hour of the eve of Tuesday of Holy Pascha. May its blessings be with us. Amen.

N~h~r/i de qen pia~bot m~mah s~m/n n~te ]rompi m~mahc~nou] hi darioc: a~oucaji n~te Vnou] swpi ha Za,ariac p~s/ri m~Bara,iac p~s/ri n~Addw pip~rov/t/c efjw m~moc: Afjwnt n~je P[oic e~jen netenio] e~fjwm~moc je eke~joc nwou:

In the eighth month of the second year of the reign of Darius, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah, son of Berechiah, son of Addo the prophet, saying, "The Lord has been very angry with your fathers, and you shall say to them,

Je nai ne n/e~tefjw m~mwou n~je P[oic pi pantokratwr: je kety/nou haroi ouoh a~nok hw ]nakott harwten peje P[oic pipantokratwr.
'Thus says the Lord Almighty: "Return to Me, and I will return to you," says the Lord,

Ouoh m~perswpi m~v~r/] n~netenio] etauerkalin nwou n~je nip~rov/t/c icjen swrp eujw m~moc: je nai ne n/e~tefjwm~mwou n~je P[oic pipantokratwr:
"And do not become like your fathers, whom the former prophets accused, saying, 'Thus says the Lord Almighty:
ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªÙƒÙˆÙ†ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ§Ø¨Ø§Ø¦ÙƒÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ø®Ø§Ø·Ø¨Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ù†Ø¨ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆÙ„ÙˆÙ† Ù‚Ø§Ø¦Ù„ÙŠÙ†. Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¶Ø§Ø¨Ø· Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„
Je matacye y/nou e~bolha netenmwit ethwou: nem e~bolha netenh~b/oui~ ethwou: ouoh m~pou]h~y/ou e~cwtem n~cwi peje P[oic pipantokratwr:
"Turn from your evil ways and your evil practices.''' But they did not pay attention or heed Me," says the Lord.

Auywn netenio] nem nip~rov/t/c m/ aunawnq sae~neh.
"your fathersâ€”where are they? And the prophetsâ€”will they live forever?

Pl/n nanomoc nem nacaji sopou e~rwten: n/ a~nok e~]honhen m~mwou qen oup~neuma n~te nae~biaik nip~rov/t/c n/e~tautahe netenio]:
But receive My words and My ordinances as I commanded by My Spirit to My servants the prophets who overtook your fathers."

Ouoh aue~rouw~ pejwou: je kata v~r/] e~tafouah cahni n~je P[oic pipatokratwr e~i~ri kata netenmwit: nem kata neten h~b/oui pair/] afi~ri nwten.
And they answered and said, "As the Lord Almighty determined to deal with us, according to our ways and according to our practices, thus He dealt with us."

The doxology of the First Hour of the eve of Tuesday of Holy Pascha. May its blessings be with us. Amen.

Paoujai nem paw~ou auqen panou]: Vnou] n~te tabo/~yia~ ouoh tahelpic acqen Vnou]:
In God is my salvation and my glory; He is the God of my help, and my hope is in God.

Kegar n~yof pe Panou] pacwt/r: paref sopt e~rof n~nakim n~houo~: all/louia.
For [indeed] He is my God and my Savior, my protector; I shall never be moved. Alleluia.

Peje ouai de naf je P[oic hankouji ne n/eynanohem: n~yof de pejaf nwou:
Then one said to Him, â€œLord, are there few who are saved?â€? And He said to them,

â€œStrive to enter through the narrow gate, for many, I say to you, will seek to enter and will not be able.

Afsan voh etwnf n~je pin/b /i ouoh n~tefs~yam m~piro: ouoh n~te tennaerh/tc nohi e~raten y/nou cabol ouoh ekwlh epiro e~retenjw m~moc:
When once the Master of the house has risen up and shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and knock at the door, saying,

â€˜Lord, Lord, open for us,â€™ and He will answer and say to you, â€˜I do not know you, where you are from,â€™

Tote e~reten erh/tc n~joc: je anouwm m~pekm~yo ouoh ancw: ouoh ak]c~bw qen nenp~latia~:
Then you will begin to say, â€˜We ate and drank in Your presence, and You taught in our streets.â€™

Ouoh f~najoc nwten je n~]cwoun m~mwten an je n~ywten han e~bolywn: masenwten e~bolharoi t/rou niergat/c n~te ]a~dikia~:
But He will say, â€˜I tell you I do not know you, where you are from. Depart from Me, all you workers of iniquity.â€™

Pima e~tem~mau f~naswpi n~je v~rimi nem pic~yerter n~te ninajhi: hotan a~retensannau e~Abraam nem I~caak nem Iakwb nem nip~rov/t/c t/rou qen ]metouro n~te Vnou] n~ywten de eue~hioui~ m~mwten e~bol.
There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and yourselves thrust out.

They will come from the east and the west, from the north and the south, and sit down in the kingdom of God.

And indeed there are last who will be first, and there are first who will be last.â€?

The exposition of the First Hour of the eve of Tuesday of Holy Pascha. May its blessings be with us. Amen.

On His way to Jerusalem with His disciples, some one asked our Savior, â€œare there few who are saved?â€?

Our Savior replied saying, â€œStrive to enter through the narrow gate, lest you should come and knock on the door and say, â€˜O Lord open (the door) unto usâ€™;

And He shall answer from inside and say unto you, â€˜I do not know you, where you are from. Depart away all you wrongful, peccants to the place of weeping and the gnashing of teeth.

Ù?ÙŠØ¬ÙŠØ¨ Ù‡Ùˆ Ù…Ù† Ø¯Ø§Ø®Ù„ Ù‚Ø§Ø¦Ù„Ø§Ù‹ Ù„ÙƒÙ… Ø£Ù†Ù‰ Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø¹Ø±Ù?ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ù† Ø£ÙŠÙ† Ø£Ù†ØªÙ… Ø£Ø°Ù‡Ø¨ÙˆØ§ Ø¹Ù†Ù‰ Ø®Ø§Ø±Ø¬Ø§Ù‹ ÙŠØ§ Ø¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ù?Ø§Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø«Ù… Ø­ÙŠØ« ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¨ÙƒØ§Ø¡ ÙˆØµØ±ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø³Ù†Ø§Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù‹ØŒ

Many of the Gentiles will come from the east and the west and will nestle into the bosom of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven, but you will be neglegated outside, dominated by your profanity. Repent and expiate, that your sins may be taken away.
